name: Page Templates for Posts
author: Gagan S Goraya

sections.description:
This plugin provides a page templates dropdown on the post edit screen, where you can select a template of your choice to be applied to the post.

The post will render in the selected template view rather than the default single view. However, if ‘default’ has been selected from the dropdown of page templates, then the post shows up in the single view only.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload pagetemplatesforposts.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

short_description: This plugin lets you apply page templates to the posts.
description:
This plugin provides a page templates dropdown on the post edit screen, where you can select a template of your choice to be applied to the post.

The post will render in the selected template view rather than the default single view. However, if ‘default’ has been selected from the dropdown of page templates, then the post shows up in the single view only.

screenshots.caption: A page templates dropdown is available for each of the posts.
